intro: Kraunhia macrostachys, commonly known as the mountain cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Kraunhia macrostachys is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun.
